_comment: FY2024 Survey Answer Schema - stores only answers, questions are in template
_savings: ~67% space reduction vs full markdown files

engagement_grid._comment: G1: Who was engaged and how

engagement_descriptions.barriers_people_who_use_drugs: The Town has put together a working group, led by the Health Department. To my knowledge, this working group has not yet conducted any community outreach efforts.
engagement_descriptions.barriers_people_in_recovery: The Town has put together a working group, led by the Health Department. To my knowledge, this working group has not yet conducted any community outreach efforts.
engagement_descriptions.barriers_families: The Town has put together a working group, led by the Health Department. To my knowledge, this working group has not yet conducted any community outreach efforts.
engagement_descriptions.barriers_experts: The Town has put together a working group, led by the Health Department. To my knowledge, this working group has not yet conducted any community outreach efforts.

disparities_assessment.barriers: The Town has put together a working group, led by the Health Department. To my knowledge, this working group has not yet conducted any analysis regarding how best to use this funding to address disparities in access to existing services and health outcomes for those communities historically disadvantaged by race, wealth, and stigma.

behavioral_health_assessment._comment: G3: How behavioral health needs were assessed
behavioral_health_assessment.other_methods: A local non-profit, the Tri-Town Council, reached out to the Town regarding needs for Youth Mental Health First Aid trainings and the potential to have opioid settlement funding supporting this effort.

existing_programs._comment: G4: Programs/services to leverage (mostly empty in this example)

practices.name: Youth Mental Health First Aid trainings

innovation_practices.other_methods: A local non-profit, the Tri-Town Council, reached out to the Town about the need for Youth Mental Health First Aid trainings and the potential to have opioid settlement funding support this effort.

planning.process: We did not engage in a planning process.

treatment.barriers: The Town formed a working group, led by the Health Department, to assess how opioid settlement funds can be most effective in Boxford. This working group has not made any progress towards this goal yet. The only funding that the Town of Boxford has allocated is funding that was proactively requested by the Tri-Town Union, a local non-profit, to support Youth Mental Health First Aid trainings.
